PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
7 October 1952
Mr. barker wheatley
WGBH, Lovell Institute
Broadcasting Council
Boston, Massachusetts
Dear Barkeri
Both of your letters arrived this morning (Oct. 6). I think
I have arranged to handle this in the most expeditious way possible.
Here are the details.
I do not have a full and up-to-date list of MAS* members.
Miles, however, does have one down at Urban*. I investigated and
found that the University of Minnesota and the University of Illinois
are both connected by teletype and that I could have the text of the
amendment teletyped down to Urbana for a couple of dollars. I
arranged, therefore, to have this done and meanwhile called Miles*
secretary in Urbana asking her to be reedy for it, to duplicate it
and to mail it out this afternoon, and to get it touch with me by
telephone or telegraph if there should be any snafu in the trans¬
mission of the amendment.
1 hope that all goes well and that it reaches the members in
time, strictly speaking, thirty days are supposed to elapse between
notification and voting so that if this doesn't reach the members
by October 8, they might object to voting on it November 5. However,
1 think it should be distributed in time.
I hope that this works out satisfactorily.
I m sorry about this business of receiving your call collect.
It isn't difficult for tm to make calls out and charge them to ay
home phone and then reimbursing myself with NAhh funds. But to
receive a call collect from outside at a university number and have
it charged to some other number than that one is just too dam com¬
plicated! Please forgive me for turning the charge back on you.
With best personal regards,
fours sincerely.
BPtcjm
__ Burton Pauiu
'"Secretary and Public aTIdns '
Editor
Representing non commercial, educational, radio and television stations, workshops, and production
centers, owned and operated by colleges, universities, school systems and public-service agencies.
